Summary: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer follows the adventures of a mischievous, imaginative boy in the fictional town of St. Petersburg, Missouri, raised by his Aunt Polly. Tom's escapades with his friends, particularly Huckleberry Finn, include tricking others, faking their deaths, and witnessing a murder by Injun Joe. The story also features his romantic interest in Becky Thatcher and explores themes of childhood, friendship, and moral development.
